rationale: GM&R entry for `Classical Greek'. Also labeled like this in \citet{wals-81}, Figure 1
OV order in finite clauses lost by 13th century (\citet{zaring2010changing}, citing \citet{marchello-nizia1995l})
Old Russian has word order freedom similar to Old Church Slavonic, which is labeled SVO. The alternative label would be `No dominant order'.
VO was dominant, compared to OV, by the 9th century \citep{west1973some}, the time of the earliest texts in the corpus. \citet{wals-81}, Figure 1, also judges as SVO.
